intro: Hypocyrta carnosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Hypocyrta carnosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its growth habit makes it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
